db_config¶

Environment-driven database connection configuration.

db_config._load_env_file(path)[source]¶

Load KEY=VALUE pairs from a .env-style file into os.environ.

Existing environment variables are preserved.

Parameters:

path (pathlib.Path) – Filesystem path to the .env-style file.

Returns:

None.

Return type:

None

db_config._autoload_env()[source]¶

Load local .env defaults when variables were not pre-exported.

Returns:

None.

Return type:

None

db_config._build_conn_info(host, port, dbname, user, password)[source]¶

Compose a psycopg connection-info string from discrete settings.

Parameters:

  • host (str) – Database host name.

  • port (str) – Database port.

  • dbname (str) – Database name.

  • user (str | None) – Optional login role/user.

  • password (str | None) – Optional login password.

Returns:

Space-delimited connection info string for psycopg.

Return type:

str

db_config.get_db_name()[source]¶

Return target application database name from environment.

Returns:

Configured application database name.

Return type:

str

db_config.get_db_conn_info()[source]¶

Return application connection info using env vars.

Uses DATABASE_URL when present for compatibility, otherwise composes a connection string from DB_* variables.

Returns:

Connection info for the app role.

Return type:

str

db_config.get_admin_conn_info()[source]¶

Return admin connection info for provisioning the database.

Returns:

Connection info for the admin/provisioning role.

Return type:

str
